events.title: *Cancelled* RAWC WOD (Workout of the Day)
events.description: Are you new to fitness and exercise? Worried about hurting yourself or using machines incorrectly? Want to get started but don’t know how? Then join us for a RAWC Workout of the Day led by our certified personal trainers. Learn the proper technique and a variety of exercises to add to your own workouts. From dumbbells to barbells, no matter what your fitness goal is… we got you covered!

events.title: Barbell 101
events.description: Barbells are one of the most essential pieces of equipment in the gym. They can help you lose weight, reduce body fat, increase strength, and build muscle. Knowing how intimidating they can be, our trainers will provide you with a supportive space to get comfortable using barbells and teach you the proper form for the squat, deadlift, bench press and row. This is a technique-oriented class.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: RAWC WOD (Workout of the Day)
events.description: Are you new to fitness and exercise? Worried about hurting yourself or using machines incorrectly? Want to get started but don’t know how? Then join us for a RAWC Workout of the Day led by our certified personal trainers. Learn the proper technique and a variety of exercises to add to your own workouts. From dumbbells to barbells, no matter what your fitness goal is… we got you covered!

events.title: Fun Swim
events.description: This is time in the pool simply to enjoy it at your leisure. The pool will be divided - the shallow end will be isolated for those who would like to stand on the bottom and the deep end space will be open for diving and play. Children of members (accompanied by the member guardian) are welcome to come to this swim.

events.title: Learn to Lift – OWL
events.description: Available for all levels, this program is for students looking to learn the clean and jerk, snatch, and other full body exercises. Participants will be guided by coaches according to skill and performance.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Intro to Coached Swim
events.description: This program is for individuals seeking a gym alternative for fitness, those training for triathlons, and competitive swimming training who might have limited coached environment experience. The program is designed to enhance competitive swimming abilities, stroke techniques, and personal fitness. This program will introduce the structure of a coached swim and provide a challenging workout for those new to the coached environment. Participants must be able to swim a minimum of 25m and be comfortable in deep water.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: RAWC WOD (Workout of the Day)
events.description: Are you new to fitness and exercise? Worried about hurting yourself or using machines incorrectly? Want to get started but don’t know how? Then join us for a RAWC Workout of the Day led by our certified personal trainers. Learn the proper technique and a variety of exercises to add to your own workouts. From dumbbells to barbells, no matter what your fitness goal is… we got you covered!

events.title: Yogilates
events.description: Yogilates blends the movements and postures of yoga with the core-focused exercises of Pilates, incorporating strength, flexibility, and relaxation techniques into one 45-minute class. All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: Women’s Only: Cardio HIIT
events.description: A 45-minute-high intensity interval training class for all fitness levels. Use a variety of cardiovascular and resistance training equipment such as Ski Ergs, Rowers, Curve Treadmills, weights and more to build cardiovascular and muscular endurance.

events.title: Women’s Only: Cardio HIIT
events.description: A 45-minute-high intensity interval training class for all fitness levels. Use a variety of cardiovascular and resistance training equipment such as Ski Ergs, Rowers, Curve Treadmills, weights and more to build cardiovascular and muscular endurance.

events.title: Meditation & Movement
events.description:
Join us for a guided meditation paired with a physical practice to help us move our bodies into wellness including stretching, yoga, Pilates, and walking.
Mindfulness is about being present and in the moment. No prior experience with mindfulness or meditation is required -- everyone is welcome, students, staff, and faculty!

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: BIPOC: Learn to Swim
events.description: BIPOC Learn to Swim is an introductory program for BIPOC identified students designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Women on Weights! (WOW)
events.description: A class that caters to women's needs and wants! Providing a safe space to get energized while building up strength and muscle. Push yourself and raise your limits with our women focused circuit training using a mix of cardio and weights. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: H2O Bootcamp
events.description: H2O Fitness is a 45-minute, fun and challenging low-impact group fitness class designed for the pool using the resistance of the water. Join us for intervals of cardio, strength, core and flexibility using the water belts, aqua weights, noodles, and stand up paddleboard.

events.title: Women’s Only: Fitness Swim
events.description: These swim times are available for female-identifying individuals only. At the same time as the swim, there may be a women's only registered swim class offered. During this swim, our facility will be visually isolated from public viewing.

events.title: Beginner Boxing
events.description: Learn how to pack a punch in this technical workshop designed to teach beginners the basics of boxing. This session provides instructions on boxing stance, footwork, and fundamental mechanics of the jab and cross. Join this fun session to stay in shape and build your confidence!

events.title: Cycle Core
events.description: This class offers a fusion experience of traditional high intensity indoor cycling with implementation of core exercises to fire up your whole body! Get registered today to improve your cardiovascular and core endurance, and strength.

events.title: Rainbow Rhythm
events.description: Rainbow Rhythm is a lively aerobics class that centers around the 2SLGBTQ+ community! This vibrant program combines high-energy movement with an inclusive atmosphere that welcomes individuals of all fitness levels. Participants are encouraged to express themselves through dance and movement in a supportive environment that fosters self-acceptance and joy. Rainbow Rythm is not just about getting fit; it’s about feeling your best self and connecting with others who share a commitment to a healthy lifestyle.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Rowfit
events.description: Rowing is a total body workout great for developing your cardiovascular fitness and muscular system at the same time.  Class takes place on our indoor rowing machines.

events.title: Stand Up Paddleboard (SUP)
events.description:
Join our drop-in stand-up paddleboard sessions (SUP) and get acquainted with the paddleboard.  This equipment challenges your balance and core. A unique opportunity to experience the popular SUP boards and get a great workout.
Minimum swimming skills required for safety. The facility swim test will be required to participate.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Stroke Development
events.description: Are you looking to get some guidance on improving your strokes? This program will allow you to get feedback on your strokes and ideas to help make improvements. Staff will watch your strokes and provide drills to help you fine tune your strokes. Please note that this is not a lesson.

events.title: Indoor Cycling
events.description: Increase your cardio and strength with our indoor cycling class. Get your heart pumping with a series of sprints, hills, and drills to build endurance, burn calories and relieve stress. This multi-level class will motivate you through music and moves that allow you to set the intensity of your workout and cruise at your own pace.

events.title: Women On Weights! (WOW)
events.description: A class that caters to women's needs and wants! Providing a safe space to get energized while building up strength and muscle. Push yourself and raise your limits with our women focused circuit training using a mix of cardio and weights. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: Fitness Swim - Widths
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: WO: Strength 101
events.description: Have you hit a plateau or feel like you’re not getting any stronger? Our expert trainers will guide you through the steps to achieve your strength goals with a dynamic and strength targeted workouts. We will use a variety of exercises and state of the art equipment in our Strength and Conditioning Center.  Challenge yourself in a supportive and motivating environment and achieve your fitness goals with our invigorating strength class.  No matter your fitness level, this is a perfect class to learn the proper technique, fine tune your strength training program, or take it to the next level as an experienced lifter

events.title: Learn to Swim
events.description: Please note that this program is Students Only. Learn to Swim is an introductory program designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Indigenous Learn to Swim
events.description: Indigenous Learn to Swim is an introductory program for Indigenous identified students designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Hatha Yoga
events.description: This gentle class begins with a guided meditation, introduces yoga postures to stretch and strengthen the body, and teaches relaxation practices to reduce stress and calm the mind. Taught in a supportive environment, this 45-minute class is ideal for beginners, but all levels are welcome. Yoga mats are provided.

events.title: WO: Barbell 101
events.description: Barbells are one of the most essential pieces of equipment in the gym. They can help you lose weight, reduce body fat, increase strength, and build muscle. Knowing how intimidating they can be, our trainers will provide you with a supportive space to get comfortable using barbells and teach you the proper form for the squat, deadlift, bench press and row. This is a technique-oriented class.

events.title: Standup Paddleboard (SUP)
events.description:
Join our drop-in stand-up paddleboard sessions (SUP) and get acquainted with the paddleboard.  This equipment challenges your balance and core. A unique opportunity to experience the popular SUP boards and get a great workout.
Minimum swimming skills required for safety. The facility swim test will be required to participate.

events.title: Bootcamp
events.description: A high-intensity class that incorporates plyometrics, strength and interval training. Build your cardiovascular and muscular endurance using various types of equipment and bodyweight movements. Challenge yourself and get ready for a top to bottom workout.

events.title: Lifeguard Sport
events.description:
Student-only drop-in program where you'll practice and perfect fun lifeguarding and lifesaving skills, build lasting friendships while discovering the exciting world of Lifesaving Sport. No prior lifesaving or lifeguarding experience required!
Prerequisites:
· Swim 400 meters continuously without stopping
· Recover an object from the deepest part of the pool
· Perform scissor kick/eggbeater/whip kick for 25 meters

events.title: Soul Sweat
events.description: Soul Sweat is an invigorating strength training class specifically designed for individuals within the BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color) community. This empowering workout is specifically designed to cater to the needs and preferences of BIPOC students, offering a safe and inclusive space to come together and prioritize their health and well-being. Build strength, endurance, and resilience while simultaneously fostering deeper connections within their community. The class aims to promote overall physical wellness and a sense of belonging among its members, creating an environment where everyone can thrive together.

events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Coached Swim
events.description: The UTM Coached Swim is a program for individuals seeking a gym alternative for fitness, focusing on training for triathlons and competitive swimming. The program is designed to enhance competitive swimming abilities, stroke techniques and personal fitness. Team spirit is encouraged through the occasional organization of social events and regular participation.

events.description: A Pilates-inspired fitness class that offers the benefits of Pilates training with an emphasis on the powerhouse muscles including the glutes and hips, abdominals, low back muscles and deep pelvic floor muscles.  Join us and get the strength back in your glutes and core!

events.title: Pride Pump
events.description: Pride Pump offers a unique fitness experience with guided support in an inclusive setting for the 2SLGBTQ+ community and allies. Join us for high-energy workout sessions that celebrate diversity and foster community. Tailored for 2SLGBTQ+ students, Pride Pump blends fitness with empowerment, encouraging everyone to embrace their identities while achieving their goals. Whether you're a fitness fan or just starting out, come energize your body and spirit with us!

events.title: Pilates
events.description: Achieve a balanced and toned body with the ultimate core fitness workout!  Incorporate Pilate’s postures with traditional core exercises to help improve posture, strength, and range of motion.  Rejuvenate your workout with a focus on your breathing and find those deep core muscles in the abdomen and that surround the spine.  All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: Intermediate Boxing
events.description:
Build upon the foundations of the jab and cross learned in our Beginner Boxing class. This class introduces the hook, uppercut, and more complex sequences focused on building rhythm. Some boxing experience is recommended if participants have not yet attended our other boxing classes. 
*Hand wraps, gloves and non-slip shoes are recommended!

events.title: Cycle Core
events.description: This class offers a fusion experience of traditional high intensity indoor cycling with implementation of core exercises to fire up your whole body! Get registered today to improve your cardiovascular and core endurance, and strength.

events.title: Zumba
events.description: A high energy and fun fitness/dance class that blends exciting club music and world rhythms with easy-to-follow choreography. Come and join the fun and find your rhythmic groove! No dance experience required. All levels welcome.

events.title: Women’s Only: TRX
events.description: This class will give you the opportunity to get fit using unique equipment such as TRX suspension systems, Equalizer bars, kettle bells and more. You’ll get a good sweat while learning new skills, building strength, and endurance. All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: H2O Paddleboard Core
events.description: Is your Core up to the challenge of UTM's Paddleboards? Engage your core and stabilizers as you move through a total body workout challenging you to stay on top of your paddleboard!  Simple movements become taxing with the added instability of the paddleboard. Light a fire in your core with this new class that is sure to leave you feeling strong,  mindful and more aware of your body.

events.title: 2SLGBTQ+ Solidarity
events.description:
A welcoming and inclusive swim session designed specifically for the 2SLGBTQ+ community! This unique swim session is divided into two parts: half dedicated to fitness swimming and the other half to recreational swimming. Whether you're looking to get some laps in or simply enjoy a relaxing time in the pool, this event is for you. This swim session is visually isolated.
Community members are encouraged to bring a friend along. If you’d like to walk in with fellow swimmers, please meet our Aquatics staff member at the Davis Building RAWC entrance 15 min before the start of the program.

events.title: WO: Hypertrophy 101
events.description: Our hypertrophy class is designed to build muscle size.  This tailored program will combine an educational piece and a targeted workout where you will learn how to efficiently build body mass and build confidence in your body's capabilities. We will focus on proper form, technique, and tempo of specific exercises and muscle groups to safely help you get to your fitness goals. Embrace the challenge, push your limits, and see results, as you sculpt a stronger, more powerful you! The class is suitable for all levels of fitness.

events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Salsa & Bachata
events.description:
Learn the basics of Salsa and Bachata, the most popular Latin club dances. This group class puts the focus on social interaction, teaching you to lead, follow, and develop a sense of musicality for a smooth dancing experience. 
Please bring clean smooth-soled shoes for dancing; partners are not required.

events.title: Swing & Cha Cha
events.description:
Learn the basics of Swing and Cha Cha and have fun dancing to Top 40’s and timeless classics. Stay on your toes with these energetic rhythmic dances. Learn to lead, follow, and feel the rhythm of the music. 
Please bring clean smooth-soled shoes for dancing; partners are not required.

events.title: Kathak Dance
events.description:
Experience a vibrant fusion of cultural artistry and fitness with our Kathak Dance Fitness class! Perfect for all fitness levels, this dynamic session merges the grace and rhythm of Kathak—an ancient Indian dance—with a full-body workout.
 Master intricate footwork, spins, and hand gestures while boosting cardiovascular endurance, strength, and flexibility. Whether you're a dance lover or new to fitness, this class offers a fun, engaging way to stay active and connect with your peers.

events.title: Sports, Games, & Play
events.description: Join our Sports, Games & Play pool time.  This time will offer an opportunity to get your friends together to play water basketball, inner tube water polo or water volleyball or if you would rather a fun filled game of Marco Polo. There will also be collaboration events with UTM Sports for organized team sports.

events.description: This program is for individuals seeking a gym alternative for fitness, those training for triathlons, and competitive swimming training who might have limited coached environment experience. The program is designed to enhance competitive swimming abilities, stroke techniques, and personal fitness. This program will introduce the structure of a coached swim and provide a challenging workout for those new to the coached environment. Participants must be able to swim a minimum of 25m and be comfortable in deep water.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: RAWC WOD (Workout of the Day)
events.description: Are you new to fitness and exercise? Worried about hurting yourself or using machines incorrectly? Want to get started but don’t know how? Then join us for a RAWC Workout of the Day led by our certified personal trainers. Learn the proper technique and a variety of exercises to add to your own workouts. From dumbbells to barbells, no matter what your fitness goal is… we got you covered!

events.title: Yogilates
events.description: Yogilates blends the movements and postures of yoga with the core-focused exercises of Pilates, incorporating strength, flexibility, and relaxation techniques into one 45-minute class. All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: Women’s Only: Cardio HIIT
events.description: A 45-minute-high intensity interval training class for all fitness levels. Use a variety of cardiovascular and resistance training equipment such as Ski Ergs, Rowers, Curve Treadmills, weights and more to build cardiovascular and muscular endurance.

events.title: Meditation & Movement
events.description:
Join us for a guided meditation paired with a physical practice to help us move our bodies into wellness including stretching, yoga, Pilates, and walking.
Mindfulness is about being present and in the moment. No prior experience with mindfulness or meditation is required -- everyone is welcome, students, staff, and faculty!

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: BIPOC: Learn to Swim
events.description: BIPOC Learn to Swim is an introductory program for BIPOC identified students designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Women on Weights! (WOW)
events.description: A class that caters to women's needs and wants! Providing a safe space to get energized while building up strength and muscle. Push yourself and raise your limits with our women focused circuit training using a mix of cardio and weights. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: H2O Bootcamp
events.description: H2O Fitness is a 45-minute, fun and challenging low-impact group fitness class designed for the pool using the resistance of the water. Join us for intervals of cardio, strength, core and flexibility using the water belts, aqua weights, noodles, and stand up paddleboard.

events.title: Women’s Only: Fitness Swim
events.description: These swim times are available for female-identifying individuals only. At the same time as the swim, there may be a women's only registered swim class offered. During this swim, our facility will be visually isolated from public viewing.

events.title: Beginner Boxing
events.description: Learn how to pack a punch in this technical workshop designed to teach beginners the basics of boxing. This session provides instructions on boxing stance, footwork, and fundamental mechanics of the jab and cross. Join this fun session to stay in shape and build your confidence!

events.title: Cycle Core
events.description: This class offers a fusion experience of traditional high intensity indoor cycling with implementation of core exercises to fire up your whole body! Get registered today to improve your cardiovascular and core endurance, and strength.

events.title: Rainbow Rhythm
events.description: Rainbow Rhythm is a lively aerobics class that centers around the 2SLGBTQ+ community! This vibrant program combines high-energy movement with an inclusive atmosphere that welcomes individuals of all fitness levels. Participants are encouraged to express themselves through dance and movement in a supportive environment that fosters self-acceptance and joy. Rainbow Rythm is not just about getting fit; it’s about feeling your best self and connecting with others who share a commitment to a healthy lifestyle.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Rowfit
events.description: Rowing is a total body workout great for developing your cardiovascular fitness and muscular system at the same time.  Class takes place on our indoor rowing machines.

events.title: Stand Up Paddleboard (SUP)
events.description:
Join our drop-in stand-up paddleboard sessions (SUP) and get acquainted with the paddleboard.  This equipment challenges your balance and core. A unique opportunity to experience the popular SUP boards and get a great workout.
Minimum swimming skills required for safety. The facility swim test will be required to participate.

events.description: Are you looking to get some guidance on improving your strokes? This program will allow you to get feedback on your strokes and ideas to help make improvements. Staff will watch your strokes and provide drills to help you fine tune your strokes. Please note that this is not a lesson.

events.title: Indoor Cycling
events.description: Increase your cardio and strength with our indoor cycling class. Get your heart pumping with a series of sprints, hills, and drills to build endurance, burn calories and relieve stress. This multi-level class will motivate you through music and moves that allow you to set the intensity of your workout and cruise at your own pace.

events.title: Women On Weights! (WOW)
events.description: A class that caters to women's needs and wants! Providing a safe space to get energized while building up strength and muscle. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: Fitness Swim - Widths
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: WO: Strength 101
events.description: Have you hit a plateau or feel like you’re not getting any stronger? Our expert trainers will guide you through the steps to achieve your strength goals with a dynamic and strength targeted workouts. We will use a variety of exercises and state of the art equipment in our Strength and Conditioning Center.  Challenge yourself in a supportive and motivating environment and achieve your fitness goals with our invigorating strength class.  No matter your fitness level, this is a perfect class to learn the proper technique, fine tune your strength training program, or take it to the next level as an experienced lifter

events.title: Learn to Swim
events.description: Please note that this program is Students Only. Learn to Swim is an introductory program designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Indigenous Learn to Swim
events.description: Indigenous Learn to Swim is an introductory program for Indigenous identified students designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Hatha Yoga
events.description: This gentle class begins with a guided meditation, introduces yoga postures to stretch and strengthen the body, and teaches relaxation practices to reduce stress and calm the mind. Taught in a supportive environment, this 45-minute class is ideal for beginners, but all levels are welcome. Yoga mats are provided.

events.title: WO: Barbell 101
events.description: Barbells are one of the most essential pieces of equipment in the gym. They can help you lose weight, reduce body fat, increase strength, and build muscle. Knowing how intimidating they can be, our trainers will provide you with a supportive space to get comfortable using barbells and teach you the proper form for the squat, deadlift, bench press and row. This is a technique-oriented class.

events.title: Standup Paddleboard (SUP)
events.description:
Join our drop-in stand-up paddleboard sessions (SUP) and get acquainted with the paddleboard.  This equipment challenges your balance and core. A unique opportunity to experience the popular SUP boards and get a great workout.
Minimum swimming skills required for safety. The facility swim test will be required to participate.

events.title: Bootcamp
events.description: A high-intensity class that incorporates plyometrics, strength and interval training. Build your cardiovascular and muscular endurance using various types of equipment and bodyweight movements. Challenge yourself and get ready for a top to bottom workout.

events.title: Lifeguard Sport
events.description:
Student-only drop-in program where you'll practice and perfect fun lifeguarding and lifesaving skills, build lasting friendships while discovering the exciting world of Lifesaving Sport. No prior lifesaving or lifeguarding experience required!
Prerequisites:
· Swim 400 meters continuously without stopping
· Recover an object from the deepest part of the pool
· Perform scissor kick/eggbeater/whip kick for 25 meters

events.title: Soul Sweat
events.description: Soul Sweat is an invigorating strength training class specifically designed for individuals within the BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color) community. This empowering workout is specifically designed to cater to the needs and preferences of BIPOC students, offering a safe and inclusive space to come together and prioritize their health and well-being. Build strength, endurance, and resilience while simultaneously fostering deeper connections within their community. The class aims to promote overall physical wellness and a sense of belonging among its members, creating an environment where everyone can thrive together.

events.description: Pride Pump offers a unique fitness experience with guided support in an inclusive setting for the 2SLGBTQ+ community and allies. Join us for high-energy workout sessions that celebrate diversity and foster community. Tailored for 2SLGBTQ+ students, Pride Pump blends fitness with empowerment, encouraging everyone to embrace their identities while achieving their goals. Whether you're a fitness fan or just starting out, come energize your body and spirit with us!

events.title: Pilates
events.description: Achieve a balanced and toned body with the ultimate core fitness workout!  Incorporate Pilate’s postures with traditional core exercises to help improve posture, strength, and range of motion.  Rejuvenate your workout with a focus on your breathing and find those deep core muscles in the abdomen and that surround the spine.  All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: Intermediate Boxing
events.description:
Build upon the foundations of the jab and cross learned in our Beginner Boxing class. This class introduces the hook, uppercut, and more complex sequences focused on building rhythm. Some boxing experience is recommended if participants have not yet attended our other boxing classes. 
*Hand wraps, gloves and non-slip shoes are recommended!

events.description: This class offers a fusion experience of traditional high intensity indoor cycling with implementation of core exercises to fire up your whole body! Get registered today to improve your cardiovascular and core endurance, and strength.

events.description: A high energy and fun fitness/dance class that blends exciting club music and world rhythms with easy-to-follow choreography. Come and join the fun and find your rhythmic groove! No dance experience required. All levels welcome.

events.title: Women’s Only: TRX
events.description: This class will give you the opportunity to get fit using unique equipment such as TRX suspension systems, Equalizer bars, kettle bells and more. You’ll get a good sweat while learning new skills, building strength, and endurance. All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: H2O Paddleboard Core
events.description: Is your Core up to the challenge of UTM's Paddleboards? Engage your core and stabilizers as you move through a total body workout challenging you to stay on top of your paddleboard!  Simple movements become taxing with the added instability of the paddleboard. Light a fire in your core with this new class that is sure to leave you feeling strong,  mindful and more aware of your body.

events.title: 2SLGBTQ+ Solidarity
events.description:
A welcoming and inclusive swim session designed specifically for the 2SLGBTQ+ community! This unique swim session is divided into two parts: half dedicated to fitness swimming and the other half to recreational swimming. Whether you're looking to get some laps in or simply enjoy a relaxing time in the pool, this event is for you. This swim session is visually isolated.
Community members are encouraged to bring a friend along. If you’d like to walk in with fellow swimmers, please meet our Aquatics staff member at the Davis Building RAWC entrance 15 min before the start of the program.

events.title: WO: Hypertrophy 101
events.description: Our hypertrophy class is designed to build muscle size.  This tailored program will combine an educational piece and a targeted workout where you will learn how to efficiently build body mass and build confidence in your body's capabilities. We will focus on proper form, technique, and tempo of specific exercises and muscle groups to safely help you get to your fitness goals. Embrace the challenge, push your limits, and see results, as you sculpt a stronger, more powerful you! The class is suitable for all levels of fitness.

events.title: Salsa & Bachata
events.description:
Learn the basics of Salsa and Bachata, the most popular Latin club dances. This group class puts the focus on social interaction, teaching you to lead, follow, and develop a sense of musicality for a smooth dancing experience. 
Please bring clean smooth-soled shoes for dancing; partners are not required.

events.title: Swing & Cha Cha
events.description:
Learn the basics of Swing and Cha Cha and have fun dancing to Top 40’s and timeless classics. Stay on your toes with these energetic rhythmic dances. Learn to lead, follow, and feel the rhythm of the music. 
Please bring clean smooth-soled shoes for dancing; partners are not required.

Experience a vibrant fusion of cultural artistry and fitness with our Kathak Dance Fitness class! Perfect for all fitness levels, this dynamic session merges the grace and rhythm of Kathak—an ancient Indian dance—with a full-body workout.
 Master intricate footwork, spins, and hand gestures while boosting cardiovascular endurance, strength, and flexibility. Whether you're a dance lover or new to fitness, this class offers a fun, engaging way to stay active and connect with your peers.

events.description: Join our Sports, Games & Play pool time.  This time will offer an opportunity to get your friends together to play water basketball, inner tube water polo or water volleyball or if you would rather a fun filled game of Marco Polo. There will also be collaboration events with UTM Sports for organized team sports.

Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Women on Weights! (WOW)
events.description: A class that caters to women's needs and wants! Providing a safe space to get energized while building up strength and muscle. Push yourself and raise your limits with our women focused circuit training using a mix of cardio and weights. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: H2O Bootcamp
events.description: H2O Fitness is a 45-minute, fun and challenging low-impact group fitness class designed for the pool using the resistance of the water. Join us for intervals of cardio, strength, core and flexibility using the water belts, aqua weights, noodles, and stand up paddleboard.

events.title: Women’s Only: Fitness Swim
events.description: These swim times are available for female-identifying individuals only. At the same time as the swim, there may be a women's only registered swim class offered. During this swim, our facility will be visually isolated from public viewing.

events.title: Beginner Boxing
events.description: Learn how to pack a punch in this technical workshop designed to teach beginners the basics of boxing. This session provides instructions on boxing stance, footwork, and fundamental mechanics of the jab and cross. Join this fun session to stay in shape and build your confidence!

events.title: Cycle Core
events.description: This class offers a fusion experience of traditional high intensity indoor cycling with implementation of core exercises to fire up your whole body! Get registered today to improve your cardiovascular and core endurance, and strength.

events.title: Rainbow Rhythm
events.description: Rainbow Rhythm is a lively aerobics class that centers around the 2SLGBTQ+ community! This vibrant program combines high-energy movement with an inclusive atmosphere that welcomes individuals of all fitness levels. Participants are encouraged to express themselves through dance and movement in a supportive environment that fosters self-acceptance and joy. Rainbow Rythm is not just about getting fit; it’s about feeling your best self and connecting with others who share a commitment to a healthy lifestyle.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Rowfit
events.description: Rowing is a total body workout great for developing your cardiovascular fitness and muscular system at the same time.  Class takes place on our indoor rowing machines.

events.title: Stand Up Paddleboard (SUP)
events.description:
Join our drop-in stand-up paddleboard sessions (SUP) and get acquainted with the paddleboard.  This equipment challenges your balance and core. A unique opportunity to experience the popular SUP boards and get a great workout.
Minimum swimming skills required for safety. The facility swim test will be required to participate.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: RAWC WOD (Workout of the Day)
events.description: Are you new to fitness and exercise? Worried about hurting yourself or using machines incorrectly? Want to get started but don’t know how? Then join us for a RAWC Workout of the Day led by our certified personal trainers. Learn the proper technique and a variety of exercises to add to your own workouts. From dumbbells to barbells, no matter what your fitness goal is… we got you covered!

events.title: Stroke Development
events.description: Are you looking to get some guidance on improving your strokes? This program will allow you to get feedback on your strokes and ideas to help make improvements. Staff will watch your strokes and provide drills to help you fine tune your strokes. Please note that this is not a lesson.

events.title: Indoor Cycling
events.description: Increase your cardio and strength with our indoor cycling class. Get your heart pumping with a series of sprints, hills, and drills to build endurance, burn calories and relieve stress. This multi-level class will motivate you through music and moves that allow you to set the intensity of your workout and cruise at your own pace.

events.title: Women On Weights! (WOW)

Push yourself and raise your limits with our women focused circuit training using a mix of cardio and weights. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: Fitness Swim - Widths
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: WO: Strength 101
events.description: Have you hit a plateau or feel like you’re not getting any stronger? Our expert trainers will guide you through the steps to achieve your strength goals with a dynamic and strength targeted workouts. We will use a variety of exercises and state of the art equipment in our Strength and Conditioning Center.  Challenge yourself in a supportive and motivating environment and achieve your fitness goals with our invigorating strength class.  No matter your fitness level, this is a perfect class to learn the proper technique, fine tune your strength training program, or take it to the next level as an experienced lifter

events.title: Learn to Swim
events.description: Please note that this program is Students Only. Learn to Swim is an introductory program designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Indigenous Learn to Swim
events.description: Indigenous Learn to Swim is an introductory program for Indigenous identified students designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! events.title: Hatha Yoga
events.description: This gentle class begins with a guided meditation, introduces yoga postures to stretch and strengthen the body, and teaches relaxation practices to reduce stress and calm the mind. Taught in a supportive environment, this 45-minute class is ideal for beginners, but all levels are welcome. Yoga mats are provided.

events.title: WO: Barbell 101
events.description: Barbells are one of the most essential pieces of equipment in the gym. They can help you lose weight, reduce body fat, increase strength, and build muscle. Knowing how intimidating they can be, our trainers will provide you with a supportive space to get comfortable using barbells and teach you the proper form for the squat, deadlift, bench press and row. This is a technique-oriented class.

events.title: Standup Paddleboard (SUP)
events.description:
Join our drop-in stand-up paddleboard sessions (SUP) and get acquainted with the paddleboard.  This equipment challenges your balance and core. A unique opportunity to experience the popular SUP boards and get a great workout.
Minimum swimming skills required for safety. The facility swim test will be required to participate.

events.title: Bootcamp
events.description: A high-intensity class that incorporates plyometrics, strength and interval training. Build your cardiovascular and muscular endurance using various types of equipment and bodyweight movements. Challenge yourself and get ready for a top to bottom workout.

events.title: Lifeguard Sport
events.description:
Student-only drop-in program where you'll practice and perfect fun lifeguarding and lifesaving skills, build lasting friendships while discovering the exciting world of Lifesaving Sport. No prior lifesaving or lifeguarding experience required!
Prerequisites:
· Swim 400 meters continuously without stopping
· Recover an object from the deepest part of the pool
· Perform scissor kick/eggbeater/whip kick for 25 meters

events.title: Soul Sweat
events.description: Soul Sweat is an invigorating strength training class specifically designed for individuals within the BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color) community. This empowering workout is specifically designed to cater to the needs and preferences of BIPOC students, offering a safe and inclusive space to come together and prioritize their health and well-being. Build strength, endurance, and resilience while simultaneously fostering deeper connections within their community. The class aims to promote overall physical wellness and a sense of belonging among its members, creating an environment where everyone can thrive together.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Coached Swim
events.description: The UTM Coached Swim is a program for individuals seeking a gym alternative for fitness, focusing on training for triathlons and competitive swimming. The program is designed to enhance competitive swimming abilities, stroke techniques and personal fitness. Team spirit is encouraged through the occasional organization of social events and regular participation.

events.title: Fitness Swim
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: Intro to Coached Swim
events.description: This program is for individuals seeking a gym alternative for fitness, those training for triathlons, and competitive swimming training who might have limited coached environment experience. The program is designed to enhance competitive swimming abilities, stroke techniques, and personal fitness. This program will introduce the structure of a coached swim and provide a challenging workout for those new to the coached environment. Participants must be able to swim a minimum of 25m and be comfortable in deep water.

events.title: Flow Yoga
events.description: Energize your day with our Flow Yoga class. Move seamlessly through poses synchronizing the breath to movement while elevating your heart rate for this total body mindful workout.

events.title: Glutes, Core & More
events.description: A Pilates-inspired fitness class that offers the benefits of Pilates training with an emphasis on the powerhouse muscles including the glutes and hips, abdominals, low back muscles and deep pelvic floor muscles.  Join us and get the strength back in your glutes and core!

events.title: Women’s Only: Cardio HIIT
events.description: A 45-minute-high intensity interval training class for all fitness levels. Use a variety of cardiovascular and resistance training equipment such as Ski Ergs, Rowers, Curve Treadmills, weights and more to build cardiovascular and muscular endurance.

events.title: Women on Weights! (WOW)
events.description: A class that caters to women's needs and wants! Providing a safe space to get energized while building up strength and muscle. Push yourself and raise your limits with our women focused circuit training using a mix of cardio and weights. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: Pride Pump
events.description: Pride Pump offers a unique fitness experience with guided support in an inclusive setting for the 2SLGBTQ+ community and allies. Join us for high-energy workout sessions that celebrate diversity and foster community. Tailored for 2SLGBTQ+ students, Pride Pump blends fitness with empowerment, encouraging everyone to embrace their identities while achieving their goals. Whether you're a fitness fan or just starting out, come energize your body and spirit with us!

events.title: Pilates
events.description: Achieve a balanced and toned body with the ultimate core fitness workout!  Incorporate Pilate’s postures with traditional core exercises to help improve posture, strength, and range of motion.  Rejuvenate your workout with a focus on your breathing and find those deep core muscles in the abdomen and that surround the spine.  All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: Intermediate Boxing
events.description:
Build upon the foundations of the jab and cross learned in our Beginner Boxing class. This class introduces the hook, uppercut, and more complex sequences focused on building rhythm. Some boxing experience is recommended if participants have not yet attended our other boxing classes. 
*Hand wraps, gloves and non-slip shoes are recommended!

events.description: This class offers a fusion experience of traditional high intensity indoor cycling with implementation of core exercises to fire up your whole body! Get registered today to improve your cardiovascular and core endurance, and strength.

events.description: A high energy and fun fitness/dance class that blends exciting club music and world rhythms with easy-to-follow choreography. Come and join the fun and find your rhythmic groove! No dance experience required. All levels welcome.

events.title: Women’s Only: TRX
events.description: This class will give you the opportunity to get fit using unique equipment such as TRX suspension systems, Equalizer bars, kettle bells and more. You’ll get a good sweat while learning new skills, building strength, and endurance. All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: H2O Paddleboard Core
events.description: Is your Core up to the challenge of UTM's Paddleboards? Engage your core and stabilizers as you move through a total body workout challenging you to stay on top of your paddleboard!  Simple movements become taxing with the added instability of the paddleboard. Light a fire in your core with this new class that is sure to leave you feeling strong,  mindful and more aware of your body.

events.title: 2SLGBTQ+ Solidarity
events.description:
A welcoming and inclusive swim session designed specifically for the 2SLGBTQ+ community! This unique swim session is divided into two parts: half dedicated to fitness swimming and the other half to recreational swimming. Whether you're looking to get some laps in or simply enjoy a relaxing time in the pool, this event is for you. This swim session is visually isolated.
Community members are encouraged to bring a friend along. If you’d like to walk in with fellow swimmers, please meet our Aquatics staff member at the Davis Building RAWC entrance 15 min before the start of the program.

events.title: WO: Hypertrophy 101
events.description: Our hypertrophy class is designed to build muscle size.  This tailored program will combine an educational piece and a targeted workout where you will learn how to efficiently build body mass and build confidence in your body's capabilities. We will focus on proper form, technique, and tempo of specific exercises and muscle groups to safely help you get to your fitness goals. Embrace the challenge, push your limits, and see results, as you sculpt a stronger, more powerful you! The class is suitable for all levels of fitness.

events.title: Salsa & Bachata
events.description:
Learn the basics of Salsa and Bachata, the most popular Latin club dances. This group class puts the focus on social interaction, teaching you to lead, follow, and develop a sense of musicality for a smooth dancing experience. 
Please bring clean smooth-soled shoes for dancing; partners are not required.

events.title: Swing & Cha Cha
events.description:
Learn the basics of Swing and Cha Cha and have fun dancing to Top 40’s and timeless classics. Stay on your toes with these energetic rhythmic dances. Learn to lead, follow, and feel the rhythm of the music. 
Please bring clean smooth-soled shoes for dancing; partners are not required.

events.description:
Experience a vibrant fusion of cultural artistry and fitness with our Kathak Dance Fitness class! Perfect for all fitness levels, this dynamic session merges the grace and rhythm of Kathak—an ancient Indian dance—with a full-body workout.
 Master intricate footwork, spins, and hand gestures while boosting cardiovascular endurance, strength, and flexibility. Whether you're a dance lover or new to fitness, this class offers a fun, engaging way to stay active and connect with your peers.

events.description: Join our Sports, Games & Play pool time.  This time will offer an opportunity to get your friends together to play water basketball, inner tube water polo or water volleyball or if you would rather a fun filled game of Marco Polo. There will also be collaboration events with UTM Sports for organized team sports.

Children of members (accompanied by the member guardian) are welcome to come to this swim.

events.description: Available for all levels, this program is for students looking to learn the clean and jerk, snatch, and other full body exercises. Participants will be guided by coaches according to skill and performance.

events.title: UTM Walks
events.description:
Join us for outdoor campus walks, led by UTM Moves student staff! This program is open to all UTM students, at all fitness levels.
Our walks offer a unique opportunity to meet and socialize with fellow UTM students while enjoying a brisk walk immersed in our beautiful campus scenery. Not only will you experience the physical benefits of walking, but you will also enjoy its numerous mental health benefits, including improved mood, reduced stress, and enhanced cognitive function.

events.title: Yogilates
events.description: Yogilates blends the movements and postures of yoga with the core-focused exercises of Pilates, incorporating strength, flexibility, and relaxation techniques into one 45-minute class. All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: Meditation & Movement
events.description:
Join us for a guided meditation paired with a physical practice to help us move our bodies into wellness including stretching, yoga, Pilates, and walking.
Mindfulness is about being present and in the moment. No prior experience with mindfulness or meditation is required -- everyone is welcome, students, staff, and faculty!

Rainbow Rythm is not just about getting fit; it’s about feeling your best self and connecting with others who share a commitment to a healthy lifestyle.

Get your heart pumping with a series of sprints, hills, and drills to build endurance, burn calories and relieve stress. This multi-level class will motivate you through music and moves that allow you to set the intensity of your workout and cruise at your own pace.

events.title: Fitness Swim - Widths
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: WO: Strength 101
events.description: Have you hit a plateau or feel like you’re not getting any stronger? Our expert trainers will guide you through the steps to achieve your strength goals with a dynamic and strength targeted workouts. We will use a variety of exercises and state of the art equipment in our Strength and Conditioning Center.  Challenge yourself in a supportive and motivating environment and achieve your fitness goals with our invigorating strength class.  No matter your fitness level, this is a perfect class to learn the proper technique, fine tune your strength training program, or take it to the next level as an experienced lifter

events.title: Learn to Swim
events.description: Please note that this program is Students Only. Learn to Swim is an introductory program designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Indigenous Learn to Swim
events.description: Indigenous Learn to Swim is an introductory program for Indigenous identified students designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Hatha Yoga
events.description: This gentle class begins with a guided meditation, introduces yoga postures to stretch and strengthen the body, and teaches relaxation practices to reduce stress and calm the mind. Taught in a supportive environment, this 45-minute class is ideal for beginners, but all levels are welcome. Yoga mats are provided.

events.title: WO: Barbell 101
events.description: Barbells are one of the most essential pieces of equipment in the gym. They can help you lose weight, reduce body fat, increase strength, and build muscle. Knowing how intimidating they can be, our trainers will provide you with a supportive space to get comfortable using barbells and teach you the proper form for the squat, deadlift, bench press and row. This is a technique-oriented class.

events.title: Standup Paddleboard (SUP)
events.description:
Join our drop-in stand-up paddleboard sessions (SUP) and get acquainted with the paddleboard.  This equipment challenges your balance and core. A unique opportunity to experience the popular SUP boards and get a great workout.
Minimum swimming skills required for safety. The facility swim test will be required to participate.

events.title: Bootcamp
events.description: A high-intensity class that incorporates plyometrics, strength and interval training. Build your cardiovascular and muscular endurance using various types of equipment and bodyweight movements. Challenge yourself and get ready for a top to bottom workout.

events.title: Lifeguard Sport
events.description:
Student-only drop-in program where you'll practice and perfect fun lifeguarding and lifesaving skills, build lasting friendships while discovering the exciting world of Lifesaving Sport. No prior lifesaving or lifeguarding experience required!
Prerequisites:
· Swim 400 meters continuously without stopping
· Recover an object from the deepest part of the pool
· Perform scissor kick/eggbeater/whip kick for 25 meters

events.title: Soul Sweat
events.description: Soul Sweat is an invigorating strength training class specifically designed for individuals within the BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color) community. This empowering workout is specifically designed to cater to the needs and preferences of BIPOC students, offering a safe and inclusive space to come together and prioritize their health and well-being. Build strength, endurance, and resilience while simultaneously fostering deeper connections within their community. The class aims to promote overall physical wellness and a sense of belonging among its members, creating an environment where everyone can thrive together.

Not only will you experience the physical benefits of walking, but you will also enjoy its numerous mental health benefits, including improved mood, reduced stress, and enhanced cognitive function.

events.title: Glutes, Core & More
events.description: A Pilates-inspired fitness class that offers the benefits of Pilates training with an emphasis on the powerhouse muscles including the glutes and hips, abdominals, low back muscles and deep pelvic floor muscles.  Join us and get the strength back in your glutes and core!

events.title: Women’s Only: Cardio HIIT
events.description: A 45-minute-high intensity interval training class for all fitness levels. Use a variety of cardiovascular and resistance training equipment such as Ski Ergs, Rowers, Curve Treadmills, weights and more to build cardiovascular and muscular endurance.

events.description: Pride Pump offers a unique fitness experience with guided support in an inclusive setting for the 2SLGBTQ+ community and allies. Join us for high-energy workout sessions that celebrate diversity and foster community. Tailored for 2SLGBTQ+ students, Pride Pump blends fitness with empowerment, encouraging everyone to embrace their identities while achieving their goals. Whether you're a fitness fan or just starting out, come energize your body and spirit with us!

events.title: Pilates
events.description: Achieve a balanced and toned body with the ultimate core fitness workout!  Incorporate Pilate’s postures with traditional core exercises to help improve posture, strength, and range of motion.  Rejuvenate your workout with a focus on your breathing and find those deep core muscles in the abdomen and that surround the spine.  All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: Intermediate Boxing
events.description:
Build upon the foundations of the jab and cross learned in our Beginner Boxing class. This class introduces the hook, uppercut, and more complex sequences focused on building rhythm. Some boxing experience is recommended if participants have not yet attended our other boxing classes. 
*Hand wraps, gloves and non-slip shoes are recommended!

events.title: Cycle Core
events.description: This class offers a fusion experience of traditional high intensity indoor cycling with implementation of core exercises to fire up your whole body! Get registered today to improve your cardiovascular and core endurance, and strength.

events.description: This class will give you the opportunity to get fit using unique equipment such as TRX suspension systems, Equalizer bars, kettle bells and more. You’ll get a good sweat while learning new skills, building strength, and endurance. All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: H2O Paddleboard Core
events.description: Is your Core up to the challenge of UTM's Paddleboards? Engage your core and stabilizers as you move through a total body workout challenging you to stay on top of your paddleboard!  Simple movements become taxing with the added instability of the paddleboard. Light a fire in your core with this new class that is sure to leave you feeling strong,  mindful and more aware of your body.

events.title: 2SLGBTQ+ Solidarity
events.description:
A welcoming and inclusive swim session designed specifically for the 2SLGBTQ+ community! This unique swim session is divided into two parts: half dedicated to fitness swimming and the other half to recreational swimming. Whether you're looking to get some laps in or simply enjoy a relaxing time in the pool, this event is for you. This swim session is visually isolated.
Community members are encouraged to bring a friend along. If you’d like to walk in with fellow swimmers, please meet our Aquatics staff member at the Davis Building RAWC entrance 15 min before the start of the program.

events.title: WO: Hypertrophy 101
events.description: Our hypertrophy class is designed to build muscle size.  This tailored program will combine an educational piece and a targeted workout where you will learn how to efficiently build body mass and build confidence in your body's capabilities. We will focus on proper form, technique, and tempo of specific exercises and muscle groups to safely help you get to your fitness goals. Embrace the challenge, push your limits, and see results, as you sculpt a stronger, more powerful you! The class is suitable for all levels of fitness.

events.description: Are you looking to get some guidance on improving your strokes? This program will allow you to get feedback on your strokes and ideas to help make improvements. Staff will watch your strokes and provide drills to help you fine tune your strokes. Please note that this is not a lesson.

events.title: Indoor Cycling
events.description: Increase your cardio and strength with our indoor cycling class. Get your heart pumping with a series of sprints, hills, and drills to build endurance, burn calories and relieve stress. This multi-level class will motivate you through music and moves that allow you to set the intensity of your workout and cruise at your own pace.

events.title: Women On Weights! (WOW)
events.description: A class that caters to women's needs and wants! Providing a safe space to get energized while building up strength and muscle. Push yourself and raise your limits with our women focused circuit training using a mix of cardio and weights. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: Fitness Swim - Widths
events.description: Drop-in lane swimming is available in our pool.  The pool set up may vary based on other programming and will include 25m lengths as well as 18m widths.

events.title: WO: Strength 101
events.description: Have you hit a plateau or feel like you’re not getting any stronger? Our expert trainers will guide you through the steps to achieve your strength goals with a dynamic and strength targeted workouts. We will use a variety of exercises and state of the art equipment in our Strength and Conditioning Center.  Challenge yourself in a supportive and motivating environment and achieve your fitness goals with our invigorating strength class.  No matter your fitness level, this is a perfect class to learn the proper technique, fine tune your strength training program, or take it to the next level as an experienced lifter

events.title: Learn to Swim
events.description: Please note that this program is Students Only. Learn to Swim is an introductory program designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Indigenous Learn to Swim
events.description: Indigenous Learn to Swim is an introductory program for Indigenous identified students designed to focus on water safety and building your confidence in an aquatic environment - all skill levels are welcome! Our aquatic instructors will meet you at your current swimming level and work with you to develop and enhance your skills. Whether you’re conquering floats and glides or beginning to learn your strokes, come by, say hi, and let us help you meet your swimming goals!

events.title: Hatha Yoga
events.description: This gentle class begins with a guided meditation, introduces yoga postures to stretch and strengthen the body, and teaches relaxation practices to reduce stress and calm the mind. Taught in a supportive environment, this 45-minute class is ideal for beginners, but all levels are welcome. Yoga mats are provided.

events.title: WO: Barbell 101
events.description: Barbells are one of the most essential pieces of equipment in the gym. They can help you lose weight, reduce body fat, increase strength, and build muscle. Knowing how intimidating they can be, our trainers will provide you with a supportive space to get comfortable using barbells and teach you the proper form for the squat, deadlift, bench press and row. This is a technique-oriented class.

events.title: Standup Paddleboard (SUP)
events.description:
Join our drop-in stand-up paddleboard sessions (SUP) and get acquainted with the paddleboard.  This equipment challenges your balance and core. A unique opportunity to experience the popular SUP boards and get a great workout.
Minimum swimming skills required for safety. The facility swim test will be required to participate.

events.title: Bootcamp
events.description: A high-intensity class that incorporates plyometrics, strength and interval training. Build your cardiovascular and muscular endurance using various types of equipment and bodyweight movements. Challenge yourself and get ready for a top to bottom workout.

events.title: Lifeguard Sport
events.description:
Student-only drop-in program where you'll practice and perfect fun lifeguarding and lifesaving skills, build lasting friendships while discovering the exciting world of Lifesaving Sport. No prior lifesaving or lifeguarding experience required!
Prerequisites:
· Swim 400 meters continuously without stopping
· Recover an object from the deepest part of the pool
· Perform scissor kick/eggbeater/whip kick for 25 meters

events.title: Soul Sweat
events.description: Soul Sweat is an invigorating strength training class specifically designed for individuals within the BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color) community. This empowering workout is specifically designed to cater to the needs and preferences of BIPOC students, offering a safe and inclusive space to come together and prioritize their health and well-being. Build strength, endurance, and resilience while simultaneously fostering deeper connections within their community. The class aims to promote overall physical wellness and a sense of belonging among its members, creating an environment where everyone can thrive together.

events.title: Intro to Coached Swim
events.description: This program is for individuals seeking a gym alternative for fitness, those training for triathlons, and competitive swimming training who might have limited coached environment experience. The program is designed to enhance competitive swimming abilities, stroke techniques, and personal fitness. This program will introduce the structure of a coached swim and provide a challenging workout for those new to the coached environment. Participants must be able to swim a minimum of 25m and be comfortable in deep water.

events.title: Flow Yoga
events.description: Energize your day with our Flow Yoga class. Move seamlessly through poses synchronizing the breath to movement while elevating your heart rate for this total body mindful workout.

events.title: RAWC WOD (Workout of the Day)

events.title: UTM Walks
events.description:
Join us for outdoor campus walks, led by UTM Moves student staff! This program is open to all UTM students, at all fitness levels.
Our walks offer a unique opportunity to meet and socialize with fellow UTM students while enjoying a brisk walk immersed in our beautiful campus scenery. Not only will you experience the physical benefits of walking, but you will also enjoy its numerous mental health benefits, including improved mood, reduced stress, and enhanced cognitive function.

events.title: Glutes, Core & More
events.description: A Pilates-inspired fitness class that offers the benefits of Pilates training with an emphasis on the powerhouse muscles including the glutes and hips, abdominals, low back muscles and deep pelvic floor muscles.  Join us and get the strength back in your glutes and core!

events.title: Women’s Only: Cardio HIIT
events.description: A 45-minute-high intensity interval training class for all fitness levels. Use a variety of cardiovascular and resistance training equipment such as Ski Ergs, Rowers, Curve Treadmills, weights and more to build cardiovascular and muscular endurance.

events.title: Women on Weights! (WOW)
events.description: A class that caters to women's needs and wants! Providing a safe space to get energized while building up strength and muscle. Push yourself and raise your limits with our women focused circuit training using a mix of cardio and weights. An inclusive, fun, and supportive environment that will teach you effective exercises and challenge you to reach your goals.

events.title: Pride Pump
events.description: Pride Pump offers a unique fitness experience with guided support in an inclusive setting for the 2SLGBTQ+ community and allies. Join us for high-energy workout sessions that celebrate diversity and foster community. Tailored for 2SLGBTQ+ students, Pride Pump blends fitness with empowerment, encouraging everyone to embrace their identities while achieving their goals. Whether you're a fitness fan or just starting out, come energize your body and spirit with us!

events.title: Pilates
events.description: Achieve a balanced and toned body with the ultimate core fitness workout!  Incorporate Pilate’s postures with traditional core exercises to help improve posture, strength, and range of motion.  Rejuvenate your workout with a focus on your breathing and find those deep core muscles in the abdomen and that surround the spine.  All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: Intermediate Boxing
events.description:
Build upon the foundations of the jab and cross learned in our Beginner Boxing class. This class introduces the hook, uppercut, and more complex sequences focused on building rhythm. Some boxing experience is recommended if participants have not yet attended our other boxing classes. 
*Hand wraps, gloves and non-slip shoes are recommended!

events.title: Cycle Core
events.description: This class offers a fusion experience of traditional high intensity indoor cycling with implementation of core exercises to fire up your whole body! Get registered today to improve your cardiovascular and core endurance, and strength.

events.description: A high energy and fun fitness/dance class that blends exciting club music and world rhythms with easy-to-follow choreography. Come and join the fun and find your rhythmic groove! No dance experience required. All levels welcome.

events.title: Women’s Only: TRX
events.description: This class will give you the opportunity to get fit using unique equipment such as TRX suspension systems, Equalizer bars, kettle bells and more. You’ll get a good sweat while learning new skills, building strength, and endurance. All fitness levels welcome.

events.title: H2O Paddleboard Core
events.description: Is your Core up to the challenge of UTM's Paddleboards? Engage your core and stabilizers as you move through a total body workout challenging you to stay on top of your paddleboard!  Simple movements become taxing with the added instability of the paddleboard. Light a fire in your core with this new class that is sure to leave you feeling strong,  mindful and more aware of your body.

events.title: 2SLGBTQ+ Solidarity
events.description:
A welcoming and inclusive swim session designed specifically for the 2SLGBTQ+ community! This unique swim session is divided into two parts: half dedicated to fitness swimming and the other half to recreational swimming. Whether you're looking to get some laps in or simply enjoy a relaxing time in the pool, this event is for you. This swim session is visually isolated.
Community members are encouraged to bring a friend along. If you’d like to walk in with fellow swimmers, please meet our Aquatics staff member at the Davis Building RAWC entrance 15 min before the start of the program.

events.title: WO: Hypertrophy 101
events.description: Our hypertrophy class is designed to build muscle size.  This tailored program will combine an educational piece and a targeted workout where you will learn how to efficiently build body mass and build confidence in your body's capabilities. We will focus on proper form, technique, and tempo of specific exercises and muscle groups to safely help you get to your fitness goals. Embrace the challenge, push your limits, and see results, as you sculpt a stronger, more powerful you! The class is suitable for all levels of fitness.

events.description:
Learn the basics of Salsa and Bachata, the most popular Latin club dances. This group class puts the focus on social interaction, teaching you to lead, follow, and develop a sense of musicality for a smooth dancing experience. 
Please bring clean smooth-soled shoes for dancing; partners are not required.

events.title: Swing & Cha Cha
events.description:
Learn the basics of Swing and Cha Cha and have fun dancing to Top 40’s and timeless classics. Stay on your toes with these energetic rhythmic dances. Learn to lead, follow, and feel the rhythm of the music. 
Please bring clean smooth-soled shoes for dancing; partners are not required.

Experience a vibrant fusion of cultural artistry and fitness with our Kathak Dance Fitness class! Perfect for all fitness levels, this dynamic session merges the grace and rhythm of Kathak—an ancient Indian dance—with a full-body workout.
 Master intricate footwork, spins, and hand gestures while boosting cardiovascular endurance, strength, and flexibility. Whether you're a dance lover or new to fitness, this class offers a fun, engaging way to stay active and connect with your peers.

events.title: Sports, Games, & Play
events.description: Join our Sports, Games & Play pool time.  This time will offer an opportunity to get your friends together to play water basketball, inner tube water polo or water volleyball or if you would rather a fun filled game of Marco Polo. There will also be collaboration events with UTM Sports for organized team sports.
